data.title: Our Upcoming Films
data.meta_description: Our Upcoming Films – Gateway Film Center
data.text:
A tradition for all ages! Grab your snacks, sit back and relax as we channel-surf for the best toons (and commercials) featuring our favorite cartoon dogs. With each ticket purchase, celebrate that Saturday morning feeling with a complimentary box of cereal and a pour from our milk bar.

We are not alone. An Indiana electric lineman finds his quiet and ordinary daily life turned upside down after a close encounter with a UFO, spurring him to an obsessed cross-country quest for answers as a momentous event approaches. | Country: United States, United Kingdom | Language: English, French, Spanish, Hindi

When a spirited young woman is sent away to live on the great country estate of her rich cousins, she's meant to learn the ways of proper society, but she also enlightens them with a wit and sparkle all her own. | Country: United Kingdom, United States | Language: English

One of the most revered folk-horror films ever made returns with a new 4k restoration in celebration of its 50th anniversary. Police sergeant Neil Howie is called to an island village in search of a missing girl whom the locals claim never existed. Stranger still, however, are the rituals that take place there. | Country: United Kingdom | Language: English

Experience the ultimate summer blockbuster in stunning 4K. When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community off Cape Cod, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down. | Country: United States | Language: English

He rode the fast lane on the road to nowhere. Nominated for four Academy Awards and featuring Jack Nicholson in a powerful leading role. A drop-out from upper-class America picks up work along the way on oil-rigs when his life isn't spent in a squalid succession of bars, motels, and other points of interest. | Country: United States | Language: English

World Premiere, 2023 SXSW. A film about why you should join a club...and why the fate of America depends on it. Follow the story of America’s civic unraveling through the work of Robert Putnam, whose legendary Bowling Alone findings light a path out of our democracy’s crisis. | Country: United States | Language: English

Director Ibrahim Nash'at's unprecedented and audacious debut. Immediately after the US withdraws from Afghanistan, the Taliban occupied the "Hollywood Gate" complex, claimed to be a former CIA base in Kabul. The Taliban finds countless aircrafts, weapons and pieces of military equipment. Over one year, Hollywoodgate (2024) shows the transformation of an extremist militia into a military regime. | Country: Germany, United States | Language: Dari, Pashto, English

Nominated for Best Animated Independent Feature at the 2024 Annie Awards. Set in the present day, Native American protesters confront the crew of an oil pipeline project, just down the hill from the land of their ancestors. The grandfather evokes the ancient tale of their Creation myth, reminding all of us that the challenges facing humanity are universal, and that we need to find our place in the great circle of creatures. | Country: Hungary | Language: English

Featuring a new introduction from Francis Ford Coppola. Winner of the Palme d'Or, 1974 Cannes Film Festival. Harry Caul is an invader of privacy. The best in the business. He can record any conversation between two people anywhere. So far, three people are dead because of him. | Country: United States | Language: English

Earthmen on a fabulous, peril-journey into outer space! A starship crew in the 23rd century goes to investigate the silence of a distant planet's colony, only to find just two survivors, a powerful robot, and the deadly secret of a lost civilization. | Country: United States | Language: English

Anything can happen during the dog days of summer. On August 22nd, 1972, everything did. Three amateur bank robbers plan to hold up a bank, but the supposedly uncomplicated heist suddenly becomes a bizarre nightmare as everything that could go wrong, does. | Country: United States | Language: English

Nominated for Best Picture and Best Original Screenplay at the 1995 Academy Awards. Winner of four BAFTA Awards in 1995. Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love. | Country: United Kingdom | Language: English, British Sign Language

A young, newly pregnant couple is forced to take in an ailing stepmother who has long been estranged from the family. A psychological horror film adapted from the Susan Hill short story of the same name. | Country: United States | Language: English

Best Film at the 2023 Fantasia Film Festival. The high-profile case of serial killer Ludovic Chevalier has just gone to trial, and Kelly-Anne is obsessed. When reality blurs with her morbid fantasies, she goes down a dark path to seek the final piece of the case’s puzzle. | Country: Canada | Language: French

After posting a video identifying the assailant who attacked one of them, three friends create a public outcry. A riveting thriller navigating the contemporary realities of girlhood in the era of #MeToo. Official selection of the Toronto International Film Festival. | Country: France | Language: French

A story for everyone who works for a living. At a cutthroat real estate office, four desperate men scramble to sell worthless resort properties in a contest to keep their jobs and self-respect. | Country: United States | Language: English

A vibrant drama that explores the precious bond between a six-year-old French girl and her nanny, and what happens when the relationship is unexpectedly placed in jeopardy. Official Selection of the 2023 Cannes Film Festival. | Country: France | Language: French, Creole.

The first chapter of The Missing Vulcan Trilogy. At the end of the universe lies the beginning of vengeance. In the film many consider to be the best in the Star Trek series, Admiral James T. Kirk is still in charge of a space fleet, but from behind a desk. Dr. McCoy and Mr. Spock convince him to take on a mission which sounds simple, but with the mysterious Khan, things get a little tricky. | Country: United States | Language: English

A masterpiece of horror. In 1974, five youths on a weekend getaway in the Texas countryside fell prey to a butcher in a mask made of human skin, and horror cinema would never be the same. 4K Restoration presented at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival. | Country: United States | Language: English

Official Selection of the Locarno Film Festival. Nora, a 26-year-old lawyer fresh out of law school, has the impression that she doesn’t have any real life experience when she finds herself thrown into her first criminal law case. | Country: France | Language: French

Winner of the Silver Bear at the 1995 Berlin International Film Festival. A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together. | World Premiere, 1995 Sundance Film Festival. | Winner of the Silver Bear at the 1995 Berlin International Film Festival.

| Country: France | Language: English. Caiti Lord has a beautiful voice that she plans to use to do more than sell cherry cocktails. As madness surges in the United States, in a most disturbing absurd manner, Caiti is overtaken by a growing sense of suffocation and copes by singing the blues. World Premiere at Visions du Reel 2023.

A short film program from a young generation of filmmakers combining visual innovation and cultural influences. The transformations that exile, having to adapt to new cultures, sickness, or pain subject us to are often minimized and rarely represented on the screen. Captured in documentary, animation, and fiction short films, the program shines a light on these physical and psychic metamorphoses.

The final chapter of The Missing Vulcan Trilogy, directed by Leonard Nimoy (actor of Spock) himself. Using a Klingon ship, the crew of the Enterprise returns to 1980s Earth to retrieve two whales that may save the planet from destruction in their own era.

Official Selection of 2021 Cannes Film Festival Critics Week. Étienne and Valérie fall in love when they are barely twenty years old and soon after their daughter Rosa is born. Étienne is left to raise Rosa on his own after Valérie leaves and does not return. That changes when he sees her on television which propels them into one last chaotic family journey. | Country: France | Language: French.

24 year old Jeanne lives on a military base with her family and a police officer. With hopes to live a life of freedom, she pursues work in finance, but will this get her to the place she envisions for herself? | Country: France | Language: French

Official Selection, 2023 Cannes Film Festival Critics Week. Winner of the Louis-Delluc Prize for Best first feature. Lydia, a devoted midwife, has lost control of her life. A series of events may be the cause of this, but it is hard to pinpoint exactly which one it is, and in the midst of it all she finds herself stuck in a spiral of lies. | Country: France | Language: French.

Official Selection of 2023 Cannes Film Festival – Un Certain Regard. Sylvie lives in Brest with her two children, Sofiane and Jean-Jacques. Together they form a tight, happy family. One night, Sofiane hurts himself, alone in the apartment while his mother is out at work. The incident is reported and Sofiane is placed in foster care. | Country: French | Language: France

The one that started the epic franchise, presented in stunning 4K. Camp counselors are stalked and murdered by an unknown assailant while trying to reopen Camp Crystal Lake, a summer camp that was the site of a child's drowning. | Country: United States | Language: English

World Premiere, 2024 Sundance Film Festival. A bipartisan group of U.S. defense, intelligence, and elected policymakers spanning five presidential administrations participate in an unscripted role-play exercise in which they confront a political coup backed by rogue members of the U.S. military, in the wake of a contested presidential election. | Country: United States | Language: English

Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask. | Country: Japan | Language: Japanese

Winner of five Academy Awards including Best Picture. Aurora, a finicky woman, is in search of true love while her daughter faces marital issues. Together, they help each other deal with problems and find reasons to live a joyful life. Come to laugh, come to cry, come to care, come to terms. | Country: United States | Language: English

Akira Kurosawa’s Academy Award-winning adaptation of William Shakespeare’s King Lear set in sixteenth-century Japan. An elderly warlord retires, handing over his empire to his three sons; however, he vastly underestimates how the new-found power will corrupt them and cause them to turn on each other...and him. | Country: Japan, France | Language: Japanese

There are no clean getaways. A loner by nature, The Driver finds himself a target for some of LA's most dangerous men after agreeing to aid the husband of his beautiful neighbor, Irene. The hyper-stylized arthouse action film received a 15 minute standing ovation at Cannes, where Refn was awarded Best Director. | Country: United States | Language: English, Spanish

Everyone wants to be found. Two lost souls visiting Tokyo – the young, neglected wife of a photographer and a washed-up movie star shooting a TV commercial – find an odd solace and pensive freedom to be real in each other's company, away from their lives in America. Winner of Best Original Screenplay for Sofia Coppola at the 76th Academy Awards. | Country: United States | Language: English, Japanese, German, French

HUMP! Film Festival is back with an all-new line-up of short erotic films made by real people for real people. The carefully curated program is a cornucopia of body types, shapes, ages, colors, sexualities, genders, kinks, and fetishes—all united by their common humanity and a shared spirit of playful sex-positivity.

A scientist injects his best friend with a compound he’s created to help her stop cheating on her wife, but when the wife finds her new fixation suffocating, the wife gets a dose too, which backfires as she falls for the scientist. Official Selection at 2023 Dances With Films New York. | Country: United States | Language: English

When real life sucks, REEL life rules! In the summer of 1986, three sixteen year old friends spend their Saturdays sneaking into movies at the local multiplex. But when one of the guys also invites the girl of his dreams to see the latest comedy, each of the teens learn more about life and love. | Country: United States | Language: English

World Premiere, 2024 Sundance Film Festival. An aspiring actor undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance, but his new dream face quickly turns into a nightmare as he loses out on the role he was born to play and becomes obsessed with reclaiming what was lost. | Country: United States | Language: English

Winner of Best Screenplay at 2024 Cannes Film Festival. A fading celebrity decides to use a black market drug, a cell-replicating substance that temporarily creates a younger, better version of herself. If you follow the instructions, what could go wrong? | Country: United States, United Kingdom | Language: English

World Premiere, SXSW Film Festival 2022. They are the unsung heroes whose message of peace, love and funk sailed beyond Britain's shores and helped shape music for five decades. Long after they stopped playing, the music played on, so they returned to play some more. | Country: United Kingdom | Language: English

Where everything seems possible and nothing is what it seems. When teen Sarah is forced to babysit Toby, her baby stepbrother, she summons Jareth the Goblin King to take him away. When he is actually kidnapped, Sarah is given just thirteen hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue him. | Country: United Kingdom, United States | Language: English

After a woman discovers her no-good beau is two-timing her, she sets her sights on Harlem to make it big as the lead of a show but becomes a diva just as the producer is trying to bring the show to Broadway. | Country: United States | Language: English

A movie producer offers a nightclub singer a role in his latest film, but all he really wants to do is bed her. She knows, but accepts anyway. Meanwhile, a patron at the club gets a note saying that she'll soon get another note, and that she will be killed ten minutes after that. A young woman plans to marry, but her mother and brother—a lawyer—don't like her prospective husband and scheme to prevent the marriage. | Country: United States | Language: English

A Black night watchman at a chemical factory finds the body of a murdered white woman. After reporting it, he finds himself accused of the murder. | Country: United States | Language: English

Unite with 100,000 film lovers in over 500 cities across six continents as the world's first global film festival returns to the Film Center. Discover your inner film critic by casting your vote for Best Film and Best Actor! Ballots supplied upon entry.

World Premiere, 2023 Cannes Film Festival. Something awakens. A young, expectant wife must figure out how to stop her husband's nightmarish sleepwalking habits before he harms himself or his family. | Country: South Korea | Language: Korean

Fear takes flight. A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in offing a politician. | Country: United States | Language: English, Russian

Naomi, a light-skinned Black child, is abandoned by her mother and raised by the virtuous Mrs. Saunders. When the girl's fixation with whiteness turns her against her own race, she is sent to a convent. | Country: United States | Language: English

An enlightening film that explores the ideas that inhabit the lyrics and subject matter of Placebo’s songs, whilst charting their evolution as a group and as human beings.
